lines.text: Enter VALENTINE

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: How use doth breed a habit in a man! This shadowy desert, unfrequented woods, I better brook than flourishing peopled towns: Here can I sit alone, unseen of any, And to the nightingales complaining notes Tune my distresses and record my woes. O thou that dost inhabit in my breast, Leave not the mansion so long tenantless, Lest, growing ruinous, the building fall And leave no memory of what it was! Repair me with thy presence, Silvia Thou gentle nymph, cherish thy forlorn swain! What halloing and what stir is this today These are my mates, that make their wills their law, Have some unhappy passenger in chase. They love me well yet I have much to do To keep them from uncivil outrages. Withdraw thee, Valentine: whos this comes here
Enter PROTEUS, SILVIA, and JULIA

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Madam, this service I have done for you, Though you respect not aught your servant doth, To hazard life and rescue you from him That would have forced your honour and your love Vouchsafe me, for my meed, but one fair look A smaller boon than this I cannot beg And less than this, I am sure, you cannot give.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: [Aside]  How like a dream is this I see and hear! Love, lend me patience to forbear awhile.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: O miserable, unhappy that I am!

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Unhappy were you, madam, ere I came But by my coming I have made you happy.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: By thy approach thou makest me most unhappy.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  And me, when he approacheth to your presence.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: Had I been seized by a hungry lion, I would have been a breakfast to the beast, Rather than have false Proteus rescue me. O, Heaven be judge how I love Valentine, Whose lifes as tender to me as my soul! And full as much, for more there cannot be, I do detest false perjured Proteus. Therefore be gone solicit me no more.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: What dangerous action, stood it next to death, Would I not undergo for one calm look! O, tis the curse in love, and still approved, When women cannot love where theyre beloved!

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: When Proteus cannot love where hes beloved. Read over Julias heart, thy first best love, For whose dear sake thou didst then rend thy faith Into a thousand oaths and all those oaths Descended into perjury, to love me. Thou hast no faith left now, unless thoudst two And thats far worse than none better have none Than plural faith which is too much by one: Thou counterfeit to thy true friend!

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: In love Who respects friend

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: All men but Proteus.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Nay, if the gentle spirit of moving words Can no way change you to a milder form, Ill woo you like a soldier, at arms end, And love you gainst the nature of love,force ye.

lines.speaker: silvia
lines.text: O heaven!

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Ill force thee yield to my desire.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Ruffian, let go that rude uncivil touch, Thou friend of an ill fashion!

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Valentine!

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Thou common friend, thats without faith or love, For such is a friend now treacherous man! Thou hast beguiled my hopes nought but mine eye Could have persuaded me: now I dare not say I have one friend alive thou wouldst disprove me. Who should be trusted, when ones own right hand Is perjured to the bosom Proteus, I am sorry I must never trust thee more, But count the world a stranger for thy sake. The private wound is deepest: O time most accurst, Mongst all foes that a friend should be the worst!

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: My shame and guilt confounds me. Forgive me, Valentine: if hearty sorrow Be a sufficient ransom for offence, I tender t here I do as truly suffer As eer I did commit.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Then I am paid And once again I do receive thee honest. Who by repentance is not satisfied Is nor of heaven nor earth, for these are pleased. By penitence the Eternals wraths appeased: And, that my love may appear plain and free, All that was mine in Silvia I give thee.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: O me unhappy!
Swoons

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Look to the boy.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Why, boy! why, wag! how now! whats the matter Look up speak.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: O good sir, my master charged me to deliver a ring to Madam Silvia, which, out of my neglect, was never done.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Where is that ring, boy

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Here tis this is it.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: How! let me see: Why, this is the ring I gave to Julia.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: O, cry you mercy, sir, I have mistook: This is the ring you sent to Silvia.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: But how camest thou by this ring At my depart I gave this unto Julia.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: And Julia herself did give it me And Julia herself hath brought it hither.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: How! Julia!

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Behold her that gave aim to all thy oaths, And entertaind em deeply in her heart. How oft hast thou with perjury cleft the root! O Proteus, let this habit make thee blush! Be thou ashamed that I have took upon me Such an immodest raiment, if shame live In a disguise of love: It is the lesser blot, modesty finds, Women to change their shapes than men their minds.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Than men their minds! tis true. O heaven! were man But constant, he were perfect. That one error Fills him with faults makes him run through all the sins: Inconstancy falls off ere it begins. What is in Silvias face, but I may spy More fresh in Julias with a constant eye

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Come, come, a hand from either: Let me be blest to make this happy close Twere pity two such friends should be long foes.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Bear witness, Heaven, I have my wish for ever.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: And I mine.
Enter Outlaws, with DUKE and THURIO

lines.speaker: outlaws
lines.text: A prize, a prize, a prize!

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Forbear, forbear, I say! it is my lord the duke. Your grace is welcome to a man disgraced, Banished Valentine.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: Sir Valentine!

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Yonder is Silvia and Silvias mine.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Thurio, give back, or else embrace thy death Come not within the measure of my wrath Do not name Silvia thine if once again, Verona shall not hold thee. Here she stands Take but possession of her with a touch: I dare thee but to breathe upon my love.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Sir Valentine, I care not for her, I I hold him but a fool that will endanger His body for a girl that loves him not: I claim her not, and therefore she is thine.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: The more degenerate and base art thou, To make such means for her as thou hast done And leave her on such slight conditions. Now, by the honour of my ancestry, I do applaud thy spirit, Valentine, And think thee worthy of an empress love: Know then, I here forget all former griefs, Cancel all grudge, repeal thee home again, Plead a new state in thy unrivalld merit, To which I thus subscribe: Sir Valentine, Thou art a gentleman and well derived Take thou thy Silvia, for thou hast deserved her.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I thank your grace the gift hath made me happy. I now beseech you, for your daughters sake, To grant one boom that I shall ask of you.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: I grant it, for thine own, whateer it be.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: These banishd men that I have kept withal Are men endued with worthy qualities: Forgive them what they have committed here And let them be recalld from their exile: They are reformed, civil, full of good And fit for great employment, worthy lord.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: Thou hast prevaild I pardon them and thee: Dispose of them as thou knowst their deserts. Come, let us go: we will include all jars With triumphs, mirth and rare solemnity.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: And, as we walk along, I dare be bold With our discourse to make your grace to smile. What think you of this page, my lord

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: I think the boy hath grace in him he blushes.

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: I warrant you, my lord, more grace than boy.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: What mean you by that saying

lines.speaker: valentine
lines.text: Please you, Ill tell you as we pass along, That you will wonder what hath fortuned. Come, Proteus tis your penance but to hear The story of your loves discovered: That done, our day of marriage shall be yours One feast, one house, one mutual happiness.
Exeunt
